intro: Meum athamanticum, commonly known as common meadow eryngo, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Meum athamanticum is often used in traditional herbal medicine and is also valued for its ornamental appeal.
